page.title: 17LOCAL FESTIVALS.
page.content: There are a large number of small fetes and festivals run by local churches,schools and other local organisations. One of the largest open days in West Kirby is the one at the Fire Station and the Concourse.The day starts at about 8.30am when the stalls are set up and the fete is opened at 10.00am by a procession of vehicles from the local fire,police and ambulance services.There is an official opening at 11.30am by the Lord Mayor of Wirral and throughout the day there are displays by the rescue services. Local charitable organisations are allowed to set up stalls,stands and sideshows free of charge and there are competitions and fancy dress displays for the children to take part in.The day which is usually in July finishes at 5.00pm.
